name: Journey to the Planets
description:
In Journey to the Planets, you play a spacefarer who must find a way to return to his home planet. To do this, you need to collect various treasures from several unexplored worlds. Sometimes you will need to shoot your way to a particular treasure; other times, you will need to solve a set of puzzles to reach your goal. Once you recover all the treasures, you must pilot your starship through uncharted space with a limited amount of fuel and find your home planet.

The 1983 cartridge release features a different soundtrack and tones down some of the more difficult puzzles.

shot.caption: This white object should be fairly easy to identify...
...if not, then I'll just simply state that it is your gun. And it fires WHITE PELLETS OF DOOM~!
Wow, an example of High Classical architecture in an early-80s action/adventure game!
Wait, it recharges your energy reserves by blasting you in the head with white stuff. Man what?
...and head out into the greater solar system.
Some planets have "shields" around them, like this one with all the floating boxes.
Others are tastfully decorated with mountains or other objects, like this one here.
And some planets have large creatures you have to kill, like these bugs here.
The Disk/Tape version adds some additional complications to takeoffs and landings. For example, some planets are windy...
...others have moving obstacles; note the thin lines...
...and some have different gravity values; in this case, the planet's gravitational field is reversed!
